column3: is a town in Primorsky Krai

column1: The relief of the territory is flat
column2: with small hills whose height does not exceed 150–220 meters (490–720 ft). The territory of the town is crossed by the Spassovka and Kuleshovka Rivers (the latter was until 1972 known as the Santakheza).

column1: Spassk-Dalny has a warm-summer humid continental climate (Köppen climate classification Dfb)
column2: bordering on a monsoon-influenced warm-summer humid continental climate (Köppen climate classification Dwb). similar to the rest of Primorsky Krai. Located quite far inland
column3: winters are somewhat harsher than in coastal areas
column5: wet and humid. Summers are slightly moderated by its lakeside position compared to areas further north or south. The influences of the East Asian monsoon on summer and the cold and dry Siberian High on winter are very present. As a result
column6: winters are very dry and there is not a lot of reliable snowfall.

column1: The first migrants from the western parts of Russia appeared in the area of today's Spassk-Dalny in 1886. They founded the village of Spasskoye
column2: which in 1917 became the town of Spassk-Dalny. During the Russian Civil War
column3: Spassk-Dalny was the arena of hard battles between the White and Red Armies.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Spassk-Dalny serves as the administrative center of Spassky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as Spassk-Dalny Town Under Krai Jurisdiction—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: Spassk-Dalny Town Under Krai Jurisdiction is incorporated as Spassk-Dalny Urban Okrug.

column2: Spassk-Dalny formed as the center of the construction industry of the krai
column3: due to the reserves of limestone
column5: and construction sand in its vicinities. Currently the largest enterprise is JSC Spassktsement
column6: which has been operating since 1907 and can produce up to 3.5 million tonnes of cement per year. The cement plant is represented in the town's coat of arms.

column1: Spassk-Dalny has a station on the Trans-Siberian Railway
column2: with passenger trains connecting the town to destinations including Vladivostok
column4: and Moscow. The M60 motorway between Khabarovsk and Vladivostok also passes near the town.

column1: For many years during the Cold War
column2: the Soviet Air Forces had an interceptor and reconnaissance base
column3: Spassk-Dalny Airfield near the town.  The airfield has been abandoned.

column1: The town features a museum of local lore and Aurora cinema.
There are over twenty monuments of history and culture in Spassk-Dalny
column2: with more than a half of them devoted to the participants of the Civil War in the Russian Far East who supported the Bolsheviks. There are also monuments connected with the events of World War II.
